alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Dixon (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 12 at 2:56PM CST until January 14 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST SATURDAY NIGHT... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... The Winter Storm Warning will be allowed to expire at 3 pm. It has been replaced by a Blizzard Warning due to strong winds and the chance for light snow Saturday. While there may be a lull this evening, winds will increase overnight to sustained 25-30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Iowa, northeast Nebraska and southeast South Dakota. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until midnight CST Saturday night. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
